person.note: Shi(5) Hao [8113] Cai's [8114] nephew. His son, Miyuan [3727], was Pan(1) Zhi's [7310] son-in-law. A descendant's son-in-law was the father-in-law of Wu(3) Fei's [1970] son. The third son of Lou(2) Shou's [1265] nephew, Lou(2) Yue [3624], married a daughter of this union. Shi(5) Miyuan was appointed to the State council in 1207. His proposal that Han(1) Qi(1)'s [630] great grandson Han(1) Tuozhou's [3326] head be sent to Jin in order to gain peace was accepted by empress Yang [4221]. Miyuan was in the State council until he died in 1233. In 1239, Miyuan's nephew, Songzhi [3728], was appointed to the State council where he remained until he retired in 1246. In 1248, Miyuan's eldest son, Tuozhi [3729], was appointed to the State council, but he died in 1249. Shi(5) Hao's son, Mijian [3725], was appointed Taifu sicheng in 1201, Liangzhe yunpan in 1206, raised to yunfu in 1207, and made prefect of Linan later the same year. Shi(5) Mijin [3726], the son-in-law of Jiang(2) Hao [3227], the father of Jiang(2) Yu [3228], who was betrothed to Wang(1) Siwen's [1758] granddaughter has the same generational name as Hao's sons and nephews. Xianchun Linan zhi, 50.9b; Lou Yue, WJ, 93.1a-19b; Yu Chou, WJ, 5.29b. CBD, 1, 475-478.
